text: (upbeat music)
- My name is Adrian Delancy,
and I'm a software development manager.

I've been with Amazon for
three and a half years.
The biggest surprise that I've had,
I would say, has been the

amount of responsibility
that they've given me
from the jump.
After a month, I was in charge of
writing a pretty key strategic document
on what Amazon should do to
automate key changes to the network,
that was being reviewed by the VP.
And so when joining the team,
they don't hold back on giving folks
responsibility from the get go,
and they would expect a lot of people.
You can't grow without

working slightly outside
of your comfort zone.
Fortune favors the bold.
